alert.note: Alert for Halifax (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 06 at 7:05PM EDT until August 06 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Flood Advisory in Effect for Halifax County until 1000 PM EDT Sunday Evening... ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by a period of heavy rainfall. * WHERE...Halifax County in south central Virginia. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM EDT Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 658 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due occurring within the advisory area due to thunderstorms. Up to an inch of rain has fallen in parts of Halifax county during the past hour. Additional heavy rain is overspreading the area and will continue for another hour or so. Overflowing poor drainage areas will result in minor flooding. Additional rainfall of 1 to 2 inches is expected during the next couple of hours. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Banister River, Aarons Creek, Ballous Creek and Bales Spring Branch. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... South Boston... Halifax... Virgilina... Turbeville... Ingram... Milton... Scottsburg... - For additional information please go to our web site located at: http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood.
info.instruction: Precautionary Statement: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
